item.title: By: Elbows
item.dc:creator: Elbows
item.description:
I believe their reasoning behind supporting the ESRB (aside from $$) is that making a system like the ESRB effective and relevent is pretty much our last chance as games to avoid direct government legislation against the sale of games. With travesties such as Oklahoma's <a href="http://www.gamasutra.com/php-bin/news_index.php?story=9681" rel="nofollow">Games as Porn</a> bill already passed into law I would say that time is running out, if not already lost.
Gabe explains their rationale behind the move <a href="http://www.penny-arcade.com/2006/05/31" rel="nofollow">here</a>
item.content:encoded:
I believe their reasoning behind supporting the ESRB (aside from $$) is that making a system like the ESRB effective and relevent is pretty much our last chance as games to avoid direct government legislation against the sale of games. With travesties such as Oklahoma’s Games as Porn bill already passed into law I would say that time is running out, if not already lost.

Gabe explains their rationale behind the move here
